TopicTitle: Project Farpoint: The Leap to Eeloo

Articles.Content: Wait a sec....where is the huge Kraken the probe was talking about? And what was that message?

All will be revealed.

Also, what message are you talking about? I honestly have no idea

Mason, I know what he was talking about. The Kraken Probe-delivered message. "A storm is coming"? That one.

All will be revealed. The clouds gather...

Mason, I know what he was talking about. The Kraken Probe-delivered message. "A storm is coming"? That one.

All will be revealed. The clouds gather...

What clouds?

If it was that message then... there, it's that message

Also, no clouds. None whatsoever. Nope. Zero. Zilch. Nada. Umm...

Just wait and see will you, guys?
RogueMason, when a storm is coming, the clouds gather.

Err...

Maybe it's a radiation storm from the sun? No clouds then! Hah! (Aurorae notwithstanding)

Of course Needles, you know better than that

Then again, it could be that others are now cottoning on to what will happen...

Hmm...

Just wait for the next chapter, guys!
The storm is coming indeed. And it's number is 0.21 I hope you have evacuation plan ready Mason. It would be sad day to see guys go POOF.

Err...

Maybe it's a radiation storm from the sun? No clouds then! Hah! (Aurorae notwithstanding)

Of course Needles, you know better than that

Then again, it could be that others are now cottoning on to what will happen...

Hmm...

Just wait for the next chapter, guys!

If I could wait that long I would.

CHAPTER 12: THE CONFRONTATION

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“How long until we get a useful transfer window?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Depends on how you define 'useful'.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Kerbin or Duna, either one is friendly territory.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Duna is coming up first, and that Ã¢â‚¬â€œ hold on, unidentified contact, closing fast.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Boost shields, power up the lasers, I don't want to take any chances.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It could be a micrometeorite...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“There haven't been any of those out here.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“And if it is and it's heading right for us, it's still getting shot.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Contact is showing a power signature. Guys, we're in trouble!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It's targeting us!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bring the ship about and lock weapons!Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Several alarms*

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“OOF!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf (in background): Ã¢â‚¬Å“What the Kerbin is going on?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“That things weapons are almost passing straight through our shields, only a small amount of energy is being dissipated!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Return fire!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Confirmed hit, minimal damage.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Keep firing! Lengas, find a way to boost shields further!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Aye!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Can somebody answer my question, please?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We're under attack, a Kraken vessel. Right now though, Bill needs your help.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok, ok, that's true...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill (in background): Ã¢â‚¬Å“Kraken, again? Ugh.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: "You say that as though you're being forced to eat a meal you've had 5 times in a row..."

*Lonestar rocks around, cables break loose*

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“FRAK!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I've got the extinguisher if you need it!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm ok, for now...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It's no good, the power supply to the shield generator is fluctuating, so I can't boost the shields any further!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hull integrity at 74.5%!Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Portside control panel in CM burns out*

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, crap...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bob, here's the extinguisher. Malrick, keep firing!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We lost a cannon in that blast!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn it, I need an extinguisher over here!Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Loud bang, another cannon is knocked out, shield control panel is fried*

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Another cannon is gone, only two are in alignment now!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“As long as we still have some offensive ability...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Captain, I don't know how long I can keep her together now that my access to the shields is limited!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Lengas, does this capacitor go here, or --Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No, no, no! That one goes there!"

Malrick: "Oh, I see, ok!"

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Another hit on the enemy, looks like we destroyed a power generator.Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Extremely loud bang. Multiple control panels burn out or explode, more cables break loose and some structural elements buckle*

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“AGH!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“WHOA FRAK!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“OOF!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn it, critical hit on a major power relay, we're practically dead in the water!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No, no!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ugh... that hurt...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I think I have a concussion...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill (in background): Ã¢â‚¬Å“Join the club...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Report?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hull integrity is down to 48.2%, we have multiple minor hull breaches along the nacelles and one in the cabin but we have that covered. Shields, from what I can tell are --Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Loud bang, ship rocks*

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“... Shields are completely gone at the moment.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Weapons?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Offline.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Propulsion?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Also offline. The reactor is still functional though.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“What about RCS, do we have that?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Most of the thrusters are online, although some are out of alignment.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok... Bob, plot a collision course.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Umm, Jeb...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Don't bother questioning me, just do it.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No, Jeb, the cruiser ceased fire and is hailing us.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, at least one thing still works, even if it only lets us talk... Open the channel.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Channel open.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“This is Jebe --Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jebediah Kerman, captain of the Lonestar LNS-038 and Odysseus ODS-037, and pioneer of many other missions, now floating aboard a ship reduced to almost nothing. This is the beginning of the demise of your entire species.Ã¢â‚¬Â

...

OH SNAP!

Good chapter anyway! Keep at it!

CHAPTER 12: THE CONFRONTATION

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, at least one thing still works, even if it only lets us talk... Open the channel.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Channel open.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“This is Jebe --Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jebediah Kerman, captain of the Lonestar LNS-038 and Odysseus ODS-037, and pioneer of many other missions, now floating aboard a ship reduced to almost nothing. This is the beginning of the demise of your entire species.Ã¢â‚¬Â

...

Hmm this reminds me of the Borg.

Well.....

That seems amusing. So how will they kill this thing? Lazor missile to the face?

Park the Lonestar inside the Kraken cruiser? After all, Kinetic Weapons Are Jusr Better

And I see hwat you did there, Scotty
Hey- use the lander as a kinetic missile!

Hmm this reminds me of the Borg.

In Outreach, I tried to find just the music from this particular scene for when the Mechani-Kraken was closing in:

Best TNG episode(s) ever

Hey- use the lander as a kinetic missile!

GOOD LORD, you can read minds across the internet too?! I thought only Needles could do that!

Yes, I did consider it, and I did mention it in the next chapter. However, I've long since finished off the story in-game, so it's unfortunately a bit late. Don't worry, the next chapter will explain why I didn't do that

I do have plans for the lander though. You know, for landing and stuff. That landing and stuff will feature in... THE NEXT STORY, whenever it's all done (I still have a ton of in-game stuff to do, and the pressure's on because of 0.21 lurking around in the imminent future)

In Outreach, I tried to find just the music from this particular scene for when the Mechani-Kraken was closing in:

Best TNG episode(s) ever

GOOD LORD, you can read minds across the internet too?! I thought only Needles could do that!

Yes, I did consider it, and I did mention it in the next chapter. However, I've long since finished off the story in-game, so it's unfortunately a bit late. Don't worry, the next chapter will explain why I didn't do that

I was thinking of that episode as well

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jebediah Kerman, captain of the Lonestar LNS-038 and Odysseus ODS-037, and pioneer of many other missions, now floating aboard a ship reduced to almost nothing. This is the beginning of the demise of your entire species.Ã¢â‚¬Â

For some reason, that line reminds me of Halo 3.

I found it, I found the soundtrack

Now, I recommend you go back and read this chapter, with this music in the background:

Outreach -- Chapter 13: The Final Evidence -- Part 2

Let me know what you think

I found it, I found the soundtrack

Now, I recommend you go back and read this chapter, with this music in the background:

Outreach -- Chapter 13: The Final Evidence -- Part 2

Let me know what you think

The last part where it goes dramatic in the song was perfect timing. Got to the last line where it says the architect of your dissolution and the song going duhh duhh duhh. Brilliant :) :)

CHAPTER 13: RETALIATION

...

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jebediah Kerman, captain of the Lonestar LNS-038 and Odysseus ODS-037, and pioneer of many other missions, now floating aboard a ship reduced to almost nothing. This is the beginning of the demise of your entire species.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Is that so? Well, seeing as you know so much about me, I suppose it's only fair that you tell me everything about you. Every. Last. Detail.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Divulging information such as that to your species would be to betray our forces and cause.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh really? If you're so confident in the abilities of your fleet, you'd give us the information, you pathetic piece of space junk!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“How quaint. Jebediah Kerman, you are to come aboard this unit immediately as per the terms of your surrender. Your refusal would be most unwise.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“As if I'm just going to submit to your demands!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“To defy us is to kill your entire crew. You have a choice. Make the right one. You have one minute.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It cut comms.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, this is not good...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, I have the main propulsion back online as well as weapons. We can still fight this thing.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No... no, I should go over there.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“What, your actually going to go over to them?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm thinking of this ship, and I'm thinking of you guys!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You heard that thing, there's no way it's going to let us live; the demise of our species?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It's worth a shot.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb, take this with you then...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“A transponder?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Do me a favour, and tag a weak point inside that thing. That is, if you are actually going over there...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hmm... Ok then, but don't hold back. As soon as you get the signal and you have the tactical advantage, you open fire on that ship, even if I'm still on board. That's an order.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Understood....Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Alright, be ready guys, I'm going out now...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wise choice. You will find seating in the interior of this unit.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hmm, looks expensive...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Expenses are not a concern amongst us. Move, now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Geez, just looking, calm yourself...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb (under breath): Ã¢â‚¬Å“Perfect, hehehe...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“You are lingering. Is something the matter?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Just a question; why does this unit look incomplete?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“This unit was scrambled near the end of its construction in order to deal with your presence around and on the surface of Eeloo. Therefore, this unit is incomplete but adequately suited to the task.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Right, ok then...Ã¢â‚¬Â *Sticks transponder on central structural beam*

Meanwhile, on the crippled Lonestar...

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The cruiser just dropped its main shielding. The lasers will cut right through that armour without a problem now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“This is good...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill (in background): Ã¢â‚¬Å“Handorf, really, I'm ok, I can move around now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf (in background): Ã¢â‚¬Å“I... oh, alright then, but nothing too strenuous, ok?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hold on, the transponder, it's active!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Beginning targetting.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Maybe we could use the lander to destroy the vessel?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It would take too much time to prep it for undocking, plus one of us would have to fly it and sacrifice ourselves. The lasers will do the job.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok then...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Guys, it's turning to break orbit!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Open fire, now!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“FIRING!Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Critical hit on Kraken cruiser*

Kraken Cruiser: *Indeterminable synthetic screeches*

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh frak, time to bail!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Kraken Cruiser: Ã¢â‚¬Å“YOU WIL--- LL SUFFE--- FOR THI----/////###1101100001101...-----//////Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wow...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“It's like Kerbin all over again...Ã¢â‚¬Â

*Shockwave impact, several more alarms*

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Damn it, that knocked some other systems out again!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Lengas: Ã¢â‚¬Å“We haven't decelerated enough to de-orbit though, thankfully.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb... JEB!Ã¢â‚¬Â *Begins suiting up*

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Wait, what are you doing?!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm going to get him!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bill, I can't see him on sensors...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“The sensors are fried, I doubt they'd be able to tell a planet apart from a feather at the moment!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Look, even if he's out there, he's not likely to be alive for long.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Which is why I'm... ow... going now! Now, get back from the hatch!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bill, you're not ready for this yet!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I absolutely am!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“There isn't much debris left here, just a few... ow... twisted structural elements...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I think Jeb should stand out from that...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Hold on, I see him!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“How does he look?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No movement... he might be... ow... knocked out.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Handorf: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Bill, this is too much for you to handle, come back and I'll get Jeb.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“No, I'm here now, so.... ow... I'll get him...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Jeb! JEB!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Come one buddy, wake up, wake up!Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ugh....Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Well, that's something.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“...Bill? Aren't you... supposed... to be... in bed?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Oh yeah, this is Jeb alright. Now come on, time to get you back to the ship.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“That sounds... reasonable to me...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Is your booster pack ok?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Don't know... probably not.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Try anyway.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Jeb: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok, it's... fine.... ow...Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bill: Ã¢â‚¬Å“I'm... ow... following you now.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Ok, that's everyone accounted for. Malrick, are the lasers still working?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yeah, why?Ã¢â‚¬Â

Bob: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Blast that debris, I don't want anything left over.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Malrick: Ã¢â‚¬Å“Yes sir.Ã¢â‚¬Â

Edited July 17, 2013 by RogueMason

Nice Negotiation.

The Kerbal Way.

Nailed it. Perfectly.

Yeah, right, ok, (totally paying attention) *attach*
And that's why I always stick MechJeb and a collision autopilot setting onto my landers and other SPPs(Self Propelled Payloads), I can then use them as missiles.
I LOVE THIS. Also, there goes the Decimator-class. (Mason, you know what I mean.)
